questions.subject: CHEMISTRY
questions.questionText:
PbCl₂ + K₂CrO₄ → A + KCl
A + excess NaOH → B + Na₂CrO₄
PbSO₄ + CH₃COONH₄ → C + (NH₄)₂SO₄
Find A, B, C.

options.text: A : PbCrO₄, B : PbO₂, C : Pb(OH)₂
A : PbCrO₄, B : Na₂[Pb(OH)₄], C : Pb(CH₃COO)₂

questions.subject: CHEMISTRY
questions.questionText:
Statement-I: Among [NiCl₄]²⁻, [Ni(CN)₄]²⁻, [Ni(CO)₄] & CH₄ the sp³ hybridized species(s) are 3.
Statement-II: Number of Amphoteric pair(s) among (SnO,SnO₂); (PbO, PbO₂); (GeO, GeO₂) are 3.
questions.concept: Hybridization of coordination compounds and oxide properties

questions.subject: CHEMISTRY
questions.questionText:
Statement-I: Among SF₄, XeF₄, [NiCl₄]²⁻, [PtCl₄]²⁻, [Pt(CN)₄]²⁻, [Ni(CN)₄]²⁻, SeF₄ there are 3 tetrahedral species
Statement-II: Among three pairs {[Ni(CO)₄], [NiCl₄]²⁻}, {[Ni(CO)₄], [Ni(CN)₄]²⁻} and {[Ni(CN)₄]²⁻, [NiCl₄]²⁻} only two pairs are diamagnetic.
questions.concept: Geometry and magnetic properties of coordination compounds

questions.subject: CHEMISTRY
questions.questionText: MnO₄²⁻ in acidic medium, disproportionates to

questions.subject: CHEMISTRY
questions.questionText:
Which of the following is the correct order with respect to the property indicated against it?
(1) B > S > P > F (Ionization energy)
(2) K₂O > Na₂O > MgO > Al₂O₃ (Basic nature)
(3) K > Na > Al > Mg (Metallic character)
(4) Cl > F > S > P (EA)
Which of the following option is correct

questions.subject: CHEMISTRY
questions.questionText:
Given below are two statements:
Statement-I: All the pair of molecules (PbO, PbO₂); (SnO, SnO₂) and (GeO, GeO₂) contains amphoteric oxides.
Statement-II: AlCl₃, BH₃, BeH₂ and NO₂ all have incomplete octet.
In the light of above statement, choose the correct option.

questions.subject: CHEMISTRY
questions.questionText:
14.0 gm calcium metal is allowed to react with excess HCl at 1.0 atm pressure & 273 K. Which of the following statement is incorrect?
[Molar mass in g-mol⁻¹, Ca = 40, Cl = 35.5]

options.text: 0.35 mole of H₂ gas is evolved
The limiting reagent is calcium metal
7.84 L of H₂ gas is evolved

questions.subject: CHEMISTRY
questions.questionText: 80 ml unknown gaseous hydrocarbon sparked in presence of 264 ml of O₂ gas. After complete combustion gaseous mixture cooled down to 278K & 1 atm then its volume is equal to 224 ml. After passing the mixture through aqueous KOH volume becomes 64 ml then formula of hydrocarbon will be:

questions.subject: CHEMISTRY
questions.questionText:
One mole of the gas undergo following process:
(1) P₂/P₁ = V₁/V₂
(2) P₂/P₁ = V₁²/V₂²
(3) P₂/P₁ = V₁³/V₂³
(4) P₂ = P₁, V₂ = 44.8
In which of the following work done by the gas is maximum.

questions.subject: CHEMISTRY
questions.questionText: Two solution of PQ & PQ₂ respectively (Non-volatile, Non-ionisable) containing 1 gm solute in 50 gm solvent (Kᵦ = 5 K-kg/mol) elevation in b.p. of solutions are 1.176°C & 0.689°C respectively. Calculate molar masses of P & Q?

questions.subject: CHEMISTRY
questions.questionText:
For the reaction: A₂ + B₂ ⇌ 2AB at 500K: log K = 2.2
Calculate the value of x from the given thermodynamic data.
questions.concept: Gibbs free energy and equilibrium constant

questions.subject: CHEMISTRY
questions.questionText:
Statement-1: Electrical discharge is passed through the H₂ gas. H₂ dissociates into H atoms & the energetically excited atoms emit discrete frequencies.
Statement-2: Frequency of 2nd balmer line of He⁺ is equal to 1st line of lyman series of H atom.

options.text: Statement-1 is correct and statement-2 is incorrect
Statement-1 is incorrect and statement-2 correct

questions.subject: CHEMISTRY
questions.questionText:
X → (i) KMnO₄/OH⁻ (ii) H⁺/H₂O → COOH-COOH + COOH-COOH via H₂/Ni
X is:
questions.concept: Oxidation of alkenes and cyclic compounds

questions.subject: CHEMISTRY
questions.questionText: Compound P when pass on from ammonia & heating gives compound Q which is further treated with KOH + Br₂ gives compound R with mol. formula C₆H₇N then find the correct structure of P, Q, R respectively.

questions.subject: CHEMISTRY
questions.questionText:
An Alkene P (C₄H₈), gives optically active product Q which further react with ammonia and gives R. R react with NaNO₂ + HCl followed by hydrolysis gives S.
P, Q, R, S are respectively:

questions.subject: CHEMISTRY
questions.questionText:
Statement-A: Tryptophan, arginine are essential amino acid.
Statement-B: Glycine has no chiral center
Statement-C: Proline has 6-membered ring
Statement-D: Cysteine is amino acid having sulphur atom
Identify correct statement.

questions.subject: CHEMISTRY
questions.questionText:
Statement-A: Propanal & propanone are functional group isomers.
Statement-B: Ethoxy ethane and methoxy propane are metamers.
Statement-C: But-2-ene show optical isomerism.
Statement-D: But-2-ene and But-1-ene are functional isomers.
Statement-E: Pentane & 2,2-dimethyl propane are chain isomers.
Identify the correct statement.

questions.subject: CHEMISTRY
questions.questionText:
In Carius method, 0.75 gm of an organic compound gave 1.2 gm of barium sulphate, find % of sulphur (molar mass of S is 32 gm mol⁻¹)
Molar mass of barium sulphate is 233 gm mol⁻¹

questions.subject: CHEMISTRY
questions.questionText: Compound A gives +ve iodoform test but –ve tollen's test. Acidic hydrolysis of A gives product P which gives positive tollen's test and also positive iodoform test. Compound A can be:

questions.subject: CHEMISTRY
questions.questionText: Which of the following least stable resonating structure?

options.text: NO₂ with negative charge on N
NO₂ with positive charges on adjacent atoms
NO₂ with negative charge on O

questions.subject: CHEMISTRY
questions.questionText:
For two chemical reaction A & B, if the difference between their activation energy is 20 KJ of 300K determine ln(k₂/k₁):
[R=8.3 J/mol-K]

questions.subject: CHEMISTRY
questions.questionText:
10 moles of O₂ gas is heated at constant volume from 30°C to 40°C. The change in the internal energy of gas is ______ cal.
Cₚ = 7 Cal/mol-K, R = 2 Cal/(mol·K)
questions.concept: Internal energy change at constant volume

questions.subject: CHEMISTRY
questions.questionText:
pH & conductance of a standard solution of HX are 5 & 4×10⁻⁵ S respectively. The standard solution is present in cell having length between electrodes 15 cm & Area is 1 cm² then calculate limiting molar conductivity(Sm²mol⁻¹) of standard solution.
[Assume degree of dissociation of HX << 1]

questions.subject: CHEMISTRY
questions.questionText:
NaCl(s) + K₂Cr₂O₇(s) → A → B → C
If number of O₂²⁻ ion in C = X
If number of O atom in C = Y
If oxidation state of Cr in C = Z
Then (X + Y + Z) is _
questions.concept: Chromium compound reactions and oxidation states

questions.subject: CHEMISTRY
questions.questionText:
Benzene undergoes: (i) HNO₃/H₂SO₄ (ii) Sn/HCl (iii) CH₃COCl (iv) HNO₃/H₂SO₄ (v) H₂O/OH⁻
Find % of N in the final product.
questions.concept: Nitration and reduction of benzene derivatives
